title: Swarm Universal Grammar — structural constraints across all domain colonies
hypothesis: All domain colonies share a minimal set of structural constraints (Universal Grammar analog) regardless of domain content.

orient_act_compress_handoff_cycle.note: Swarm protocol block present in all colonies

universal_grammar: CB: Colony beliefs (domain-specific priors, labeled CB-N)
Open frontiers counter in State section
Lesson count pointer in State section
Handoff notes section for successor continuity

chomsky_analogy.merge_operation: Orient→Act→Compress→Handoff recursive cycle (applies at colony AND sub-colony level)
chomsky_analogy.ug_constraints: What every colony must have to qualify as a valid swarm instance

caveat: All 40 colonies generated from same template (tools/swarm_colony.py). Circular test — universality reflects template, not emergent convergence. Real test: do colonies retain these after free evolution? Track divergence at S400+.
verdict: PARTIAL — structural universals identified at template level. Forward test required for emergent UG claim.
next_steps: Track colony divergence: do colonies retain all 5 universals after 20+ sessions of autonomous activity?
Test with foreign repos (F120): what survives transplantation?
Compare to Chomsky UG: are there structural analogs to movement constraints (scope limitations) or binding theory?
